message:
Thanks Stephen. I tried with BufferBlock initializing it as:   
new BufferBlock<item>(new ExecutionDataflowBlockOptions { BoundedCapacity = maxCapacity, maxDegreeOfParallelism = maxDegreeOfParallelism,}) with both parameters set to 8 with the rest of the code as I had it before; but I still see the same behavior, i.e. sequential processing of the items in the block. From doing further research on this it looks like BufferBlock is just not designed for this. I tried to re-write my code using ActionBlock which apparently supports concurrent processing and throttling but no luck there as well. I posted it on SO here: [http://stackoverflow.com/qu...](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39150903/concurrent-parallel-job-processing-with-throttling-using-actionblock-in-tpl-data "http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39150903/concurrent-parallel-job-processing-with-throttling-using-actionblock-in-tpl-data")
